intro: Cremastosperma longicuspe, commonly known as the long-beaked grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant produces pods that contain small, rounded seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Cremastosperma longicuspe plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for grazing animals.
